intro: Calceolaria penlandii, commonly known as Penland's slipper orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of central Mexico. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its unique, slipper-shaped flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant produces small, tubular leaves and thrives in cool, moist environments with well-drained soil. Calceolaria penlandii is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it adapts to harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and rare species within its native range.
